sentence.Network_en: The first part of his plan was to ingratiate himself with the members of the committee.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的计划的第一步是拉拢委员会的成员。

sentence.Network_en: She quickly sought to ingratiate herself with the new administration.
sentence.Network_cn: 她很快就试图使她自己获得新政府的欢心.

sentence.Network_en: He did his best to ingratiate himself with the royal family.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... gratuity n 赏钱；赠品 ingratiate v 迎合，讨好 ingratiating a 讨好的，诌媚的.
ingrate 忘恩负义者ingratiate 使迎合ingratiating 逢迎的

list.abs: ingratiation 奉承ingratiation tactics 讨好策略ingratitude 忘恩负义
He contrived an eager , ingratiating smile , which he bestowed on Mr. Squires ., 他装出一副殷勤 , 讨好的笑脸 , 并把它投向史奎尔斯先生.
someone with an assured and ingratiating manner ., 有确实的和迷人的举止的人.
an Lushan , an enormously fat man , was adept at playing buffoon in order to ingratiate himself .安禄山是一个非常肥胖的男人，擅长表演小丑来取悦自己。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin in gratiam 'into favour', on the pattern of obsolete Italian ingratiare, earlier form of ingraziare

entry.def: If someone tries to ingratiate themselves with you, they do things to try and make you like them.

example.ex: Many politicians are trying to ingratiate themselves with her.
example.tran: 许多政客都设法讨她的欢心。

means.word_mean: 1. gain favor with somebody by deliberate efforts

auth_sentence.content: That sufficed; he was born to ingratiate.
auth_sentence.res_content: That sufficed; he was born to ingratiate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That sufficed; he was born to ingratiate.

auth_sentence.content: That will definitely ingratiate you with the demographic, the producer said.
auth_sentence.res_content: That will definitely ingratiate you with the demographic, the producer said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That will definitely ingratiate you with the demographic, the producer said.

auth_sentence.content: He neither frowned nor smiled, and made no attempt to ingratiate.
auth_sentence.res_content: He neither frowned nor smiled, and made no attempt to ingratiate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He neither frowned nor smiled, and made no attempt to ingratiate.

stems_affixes.word_buile: grate=grat感激,高兴+ful充满……的→adj.[to,for]感激的;感谢的
gratuity[[n.赏钱,小费]]涔吹腫给小费可多可少]→所以"无缘无故"的
ingratiate[v.逢迎,讨好]+ing……的→adj.讨好的,谄媚的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 优美,文雅;恩惠,恩泽;宽限,缓刑;感恩祷告
stems_affixes.word_buile: grace=grat感激,高兴→感激别人态度一定好,所以grace有了"文雅"的意义
grat感激,高兴+itude状态→n.感激,感谢
grat感激,高兴+uity=ity表名词→因感激而给小钱,小费
in不+grat感激,高兴+e→不感谢→忘恩负义

stems_affixes.value_cn: 祝贺, 庆贺, 恭喜
stems_affixes.word_buile: con共同+gratulate[v.欢迎, 祝]→v.祝贺, 庆贺, 恭喜
grat感激,高兴+ify使……→使[人]满足,高兴
grat感激,高兴+ulate→让[别人]高兴→祝贺
in使……+grat感激,高兴+iate表动词→使别人高兴→讨好

sentences.en: He did his best to ingratiate himself with his employer.
She quickly sought to ingratiate herself with the new administration.
sentences.cn: 她很快就试图使她自己获得新政府的欢心。
